texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Installing snort from ports on FreeBSD is pretty straightforward, but there are some 'gotchas' that you need to be aware of. Here's a step by step:
texts.text: Installing snort from ports on FreeBSD is pretty straightforward, but there are some 'gotchas' that you need to be aware of. Here's a step by step:

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Compile snort form the ports tree:
texts.text: Compile snort form the ports tree:

texts.label: code
texts.orig:
# portinstall snort
-- OR --
# make -C /usr/ports/security/snort install all
texts.text:
# portinstall snort
-- OR --
# make -C /usr/ports/security/snort install all

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: You will be asked about which support you want to add to snort, so be sure to choose MySQL (unless you're not going to use MySQL). When the build is complete, you'll need oinkmaster as well to update your snort rules:
texts.text: You will be asked about which support you want to add to snort, so be sure to choose MySQL (unless you're not going to use MySQL). When the build is complete, you'll need oinkmaster as well to update your snort rules:

texts.label: code
texts.orig:
# portinstall oinkmaster
-- OR --
# make -C /usr/ports/security/oinkmaster install all
texts.text:
# portinstall oinkmaster
-- OR --
# make -C /usr/ports/security/oinkmaster install all

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Oinkmaster needs a snort download code/hash to be able to get your rules for you. Go to  http://snort.org  and register for an account. You'll be given a hash (looks SHA-1-ish) at the bottom of your main account page. Copy /usr/local/etc/oinkmaster.conf.sample to /usr/local/etc/oinkmaster.conf:
texts.text: Oinkmaster needs a snort download code/hash to be able to get your rules for you. Go to  http://snort.org  and register for an account. You'll be given a hash (looks SHA-1-ish) at the bottom of your main account page. Copy /usr/local/etc/oinkmaster.conf.sample to /usr/local/etc/oinkmaster.conf:

texts.label: code
texts.orig: # cp /usr/local/etc/oinkmaster.conf.sample /usr/local/etc/oinkmaster.conf
texts.text: # cp /usr/local/etc/oinkmaster.conf.sample /usr/local/etc/oinkmaster.conf

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Replace   with the hash you received from snort.org in /usr/local/etc/oinkmaster.conf and uncomment the line:
texts.text: Replace   with the hash you received from snort.org in /usr/local/etc/oinkmaster.conf and uncomment the line:

texts.label: code
texts.orig:
# Example for Snort-current ("current" means cvs snapshots).
url = http://www.snort.org/pub-bin/oinkmaster.cgi/<oinkcode>/snortrules-snapshot-CURRENT.tar.gz
texts.text:
# Example for Snort-current ("current" means cvs snapshots).
url = http://www.snort.org/pub-bin/oinkmaster.cgi/<oinkcode>/snortrules-snapshot-CURRENT.tar.gz

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Now that oinkmaster is set up, you can update your snort rules using this command:
texts.text: Now that oinkmaster is set up, you can update your snort rules using this command:

texts.label: code
texts.orig:
# oinkmaster -o /usr/local/etc/snort/rules/
Loading /usr/local/etc/oinkmaster.conf
Downloading file from http://www.snort.org/pub-bin/oinkmaster.cgi/*oinkcode*/snortrules-snapshot-CURRENT.tar.gz... done.
Archive successfully downloaded, unpacking... done.
Setting up rules structures... done.
Processing downloaded rules... disabled 0, enabled 0, modified 0, total=9942
Setting up rules structures... done.
Comparing new files to the old ones... done.
Updating local rules files... done.
texts.text:
# oinkmaster -o /usr/local/etc/snort/rules/
Loading /usr/local/etc/oinkmaster.conf
Downloading file from http://www.snort.org/pub-bin/oinkmaster.cgi/*oinkcode*/snortrules-snapshot-CURRENT.tar.gz... done.
Archive successfully downloaded, unpacking... done.
Setting up rules structures... done.
Processing downloaded rules... disabled 0, enabled 0, modified 0, total=9942
Setting up rules structures... done.
Comparing new files to the old ones... done.
Updating local rules files... done.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Create the snort database and user:
texts.text: Create the snort database and user:

texts.label: code
paragraph
texts.orig: There's a script that is pre-packaged with snort to set up the tables for you:
texts.text: There's a script that is pre-packaged with snort to set up the tables for you:

texts.label: code
texts.orig: # mysql -u snort -psnortpassword snort < /usr/local/share/examples/snort/create_mysql
texts.text: # mysql -u snort -psnortpassword snort < /usr/local/share/examples/snort/create_mysql

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Now it's time to make changes in the snort.conf:
texts.text: Now it's time to make changes in the snort.conf:

texts.label: code
texts.orig: # nano -w /usr/local/etc/snort/snort.conf
texts.text: # nano -w /usr/local/etc/snort/snort.conf

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Uncomment and configure these lines:
texts.text: Uncomment and configure these lines:

texts.label: code
texts.orig:
# config detection: search-method lowmem
# output alert_syslog: LOG_AUTH LOG_ALERT
# output database: log, mysql, user=root password=test dbname=db host=localhost
texts.text:
# config detection: search-method lowmem
# output alert_syslog: LOG_AUTH LOG_ALERT
# output database: log, mysql, user=root password=test dbname=db host=localhost

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Uncomment all of the
texts.text: Uncomment all of the

texts.label: code
texts.orig: include $RULE_PATH/*.rules
texts.text: include $RULE_PATH/*.rules

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: lines except for this one:
texts.text: lines except for this one:

texts.label: code
texts.orig: # include $RULE_PATH/local.rules [comment this line out]
texts.text: # include $RULE_PATH/local.rules [comment this line out]

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Now, enable snort in the /etc/rc.conf and start it up:
texts.text: Now, enable snort in the /etc/rc.conf and start it up:

texts.label: code
texts.orig:
# echo "snort_enable=\"YES\"" >> /etc/rc.conf
# /usr/local/etc/rc.d/snort start
Starting snort.
texts.text:
# echo "snort_enable=\"YES\"" >> /etc/rc.conf
# /usr/local/etc/rc.d/snort start
Starting snort.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: If you run
texts.text: If you run

texts.label: code
texts.orig: tail /var/log/messages
texts.text: tail /var/log/messages

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: , you should get some output like this:
texts.text: , you should get some output like this:

texts.label: code
texts.orig:
snort[12558]: Initializing daemon mode
kernel: fxp0: promiscuous mode enabled
snort[12559]: PID path stat checked out ok, PID path set to /var/run/
snort[12559]: Writing PID "12559" to file "/var/run//snort_fxp0.pid"
snort[12559]: Daemon initialized, signaled parent pid: 12558
snort[12558]: Daemon parent exiting
snort[12559]: Snort initialization completed successfully (pid=12559)
texts.text:
snort[12558]: Initializing daemon mode
kernel: fxp0: promiscuous mode enabled
snort[12559]: PID path stat checked out ok, PID path set to /var/run/
snort[12559]: Writing PID "12559" to file "/var/run//snort_fxp0.pid"
snort[12559]: Daemon initialized, signaled parent pid: 12558
snort[12558]: Daemon parent exiting
snort[12559]: Snort initialization completed successfully (pid=12559)

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: If you see an error like this, don't worry, nothing's wrong:
texts.text: If you see an error like this, don't worry, nothing's wrong:

texts.label: code
texts.orig: snort[12559]: Not Using PCAP_FRAMES
texts.text: snort[12559]: Not Using PCAP_FRAMES

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: To test snort, run a ping against your server from an outside source, and you should see something in your syslog like this:
texts.text: To test snort, run a ping against your server from an outside source, and you should see something in your syslog like this:

texts.label: code
texts.orig:
snort[12559]: [1:368:6] ICMP PING BSDtype [Classification: Misc activity] [Priority: 3]: {ICMP} xxx.xxx.xxx.xxx -> xxx.xxx.xxx.xxx
snort[12559]: [1:366:7] ICMP PING *NIX [Classification: Misc activity] [Priority: 3]: {ICMP} xxx.xxx.xxx.xxx -> xxx.xxx.xxx.xxx
snort[12559]: [1:384:5] ICMP PING [Classification: Misc activity] [Priority: 3]: {ICMP} xxx.xxx.xxx.xxx -> xxx.xxx.xxx.xxx
texts.text:
snort[12559]: [1:368:6] ICMP PING BSDtype [Classification: Misc activity] [Priority: 3]: {ICMP} xxx.xxx.xxx.xxx -> xxx.xxx.xxx.xxx
snort[12559]: [1:366:7] ICMP PING *NIX [Classification: Misc activity] [Priority: 3]: {ICMP} xxx.xxx.xxx.xxx -> xxx.xxx.xxx.xxx
snort[12559]: [1:384:5] ICMP PING [Classification: Misc activity] [Priority: 3]: {ICMP} xxx.xxx.xxx.xxx -> xxx.xxx.xxx.xxx

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Installing BASE is pretty simple. You'll need the adodb port plus the BASE tarball from SourceForge:
texts.text: Installing BASE is pretty simple. You'll need the adodb port plus the BASE tarball from SourceForge:

texts.label: code
texts.orig:
# portinstall adodb
-- OR --
# make -C /usr/ports/databases/adodb install clean
texts.text:
# portinstall adodb
-- OR --
# make -C /usr/ports/databases/adodb install clean

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: After you expand the tarball, go to your BASE install's URL in a browser. It will ask for the path to adodb, which is /usr/local/share/adodb. Provide the snort database information on the third screen and then just finish out the wizard. You will then be all set!
texts.text: After you expand the tarball, go to your BASE install's URL in a browser. It will ask for the path to adodb, which is /usr/local/share/adodb. Provide the snort database information on the third screen and then just finish out the wizard. You will then be all set!
